channel.title: What are scripts?
channel.description: I know, This is a lame question but...What are scripts and how do I use them?? :confused:

item.title: What are scripts?
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

In all honesty this is what makes this community a failure. Not the 10 year olds, no. The 10 year olds are a great chance to teach someone computers at a younger age. The problem with the community are the people who think that they aren’t the problem with the community. Self criticism and removing your ego is a gift in this case.

  1. Did your post help someone?
  2. Are you sure that you are a completely accurate? Sometimes you think you know what you’re talking about, but are actually a little bit off (in this topic that would be specifically XxKanexX’s post)
  3. Could your post even marginally be considered a spark for a flame war? Anything negative whatsoever is a spark.

I don’t think this community has much hope if ninety percent of its members have the “Get rid of the noobs and we’ll be fine” attitude. When you have time, check out how a big community like eAthena (Ragnarok private server) handles people new to the scene.

Read full topic

item.title: What are scripts?
item.dc:creator: @Twilight_Kite Twilight Kite
item.description:
@Twilight_Kite wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:12, topic:149631”]I don’t know if you know yet, but I’ll just write a brief.

Scripts are code recognized by compilers…
Compilers read the code and run it…

So if you put Java coding into a Pascal compiler, it wouldn’t work.
Scar is a compiler for code based off Pascal.

Make sense? Feel free to ask more questions if you wish.[/quote]Thanks,that helped alot.[quote=“ninja nub, post:9, topic:149631”]Twilight Kite Click here![/quote]…I don’t care.[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:8, topic:149631”][quote author=ninja nub link=topic=205021.msg1807151#msg1807151 date=1191741363]
Why are there 10 year olds on here? Is this the same kid who said his mom won’t buy him a piano because he’s too young?
[/quote]

Lol, that made me fall out of my chair xD[/quote]Umm…What’s the funny part?

Read full topic

item.title: What are scripts?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

I don’t know if you know yet, but I’ll just write a brief.

Scripts are code recognized by compilers…
Compilers read the code and run it…

So if you put Java coding into a Pascal compiler, it wouldn’t work.
Scar is a compiler for code based off Pascal.

Make sense? Feel free to ask more questions if you wish.

Read full topic

item.title: What are scripts?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Scripting language

A scripting or script language is a programming language for a special run-time environment that automates the execution of tasks; the tasks could alternatively be executed one-by-one by a human operator. Scripting languages are often interpreted (rather than compiled). Primitives are usually the elementary tasks or API calls[clarification needed], and the language allows them to be combined into more programs. Environments that can be automated through scripting include software applications, w...
